General.name: Name
General.title: Title
General.sendUsYourBadge: Send your badge to support@openbadges.education and we will be glad to take a look.

Start.desc2: for documenting & feedback on the learning process
Start.poweredBy: Open Educational Badges is a joint project by matrix gGmbH, mycelia gGmbH and openSenseLab gGmbH.
Start.ourIdeaDesc:
With the help of Mozilla's Open Badges, we are developing an open and scalable documentation system for verifying acquired skills and abilities in school and extracurricular settings.

Through an e-portfolio, the badges are contextualized and the learning achievements are documented.
Start.ourApproachDesc: Our feedback system motivates participants to learn with joy and helps them to realistically assess their own progress. At the same time, it offers learning support guidance on the level of achievement and thus forms an important basis for the further didactic-pedagogical planning of the learning process.
Start.ApproachPrinciples: Our approach is based on 6 principles:
Start.openDesc: Other institutions can expand and further develop the system according to their educational offerings.
Start.transFlexDesc: The learner has insight into their portfolio and can independently decide who to make which information available to.
Start.standardDesc: By the collaboration of various educational actors, a standardization tool is created that provides orientation.
Start.motivDesc: “Portfolio & Badges” are a form of performance presentation; not evaluation. They promote appreciation for the acquired skills and increase the learner's self-responsibility.
Start.digitalDesc: We rely on established technical standards with which digital credentials can be created and managed decentrally.
Start.individDesc: “Portfolio & Badges” can document individual learning paths and thus promote self-determined, lifelong learning.
Start.serverDown: Oops! The server is not responding.
Start.text1: Badges are digital credentials that, like certificates, can be easily and time-efficiently awarded and collected to make learning achievements and skill acquisition visible - both for digital learning opportunities and for on-site offerings.
Start.knowWhatIcan: I KNOW WHAT I CAN DO!
Start.knowWhatIcan_text: We strengthen the sovereignty of learners by giving them transparency about their skills.
Start.bridges_text: We make extracurricular skill acquisition equally visible and thereby promote it.
Start.threeElementsHeadline: Open Educational Badges consists of three elements:
Start.threeEleText1: A technical solution for awarding and collecting badges. This functionality can be embedded into existing learning environments via a plug-in.
Start.threeEleText2: A standardized, open and scalable competence framework based on ESCO, which ensures the value of the badges and enables cross-institutional learning.
Start.threeEleText3: An open community that creates, awards, and acquires badges, while simultaneously ensuring their quality through a community review principle.
Start.threeEleFooter: Open Educational Badges are therefore shareable, scalable, connectable, and thus a new currency is created to map skills.
Start.headline3_1: This is how you can use Open Educational Badges.
Start.forEleHeadlinet1: Create an account and create an institution
Start.forEleText1: Create an account on Open Educational Badges and register your institution.
Start.forEleText2: Use the AI badge assistant to create badges for your learning offer in minutes.
Start.forEleText3: You can award badges to your learners via email or QR code.
Start.forEleText4: Learners receive badges with their acquired skills. This gives them a better overview of their abilities.
Start.usingOEB: These institutions are already using Open Educational Badges
Start.signupNow: Sign up now and start awarding badges

Issuer.herebyIConfirm:
I hereby confirm that I...

    1. am authorized to create an account for the named institution and to create and award badges.

    2. am responsible for the quality of the courses offered, the badges created and awarded and for the competences assigned.

    3. use the platform only for the intended purposes and reject any misuse.

escoSearch.headline: ESCO Competencies
escoSearch.description: To ensure our badges are standardized and comparable in terms of content, the AI assistant uses the European Classification of Skills, Competences and Occupations (ESCO). You can search for suitable skills yourself here and add them:

CreateBadge.competencyOwnDescription: If the ESCO search does not provide a suitable skill, you can manually add a self-defined skill here:
CreateBadge.weHelpCreateBadge: We'll help you create your badge in just a few steps.
CreateBadge.subjectMatter: Write down what your learning program teaches in terms of <u>subject matter</u>.
CreateBadge.howLearningWorks: Also describe <u>how</u> the learning takes place.
CreateBadge.inAddition: In addition to subject-specific skills, <u>soft skills</u> such as social, communication, or problem-solving skills can often be acquired through teamwork, experimentation or planning.
CreateBadge.aiAssistantNote: Note: AI support – the Badge Assistant can make mistakes. Therefore, please check the suggestions and report any incorrect results by email. Data protection at OEB.
CreateBadge.activityEndDateRequired: End date is required and may not be before the start date

Legend.legendDesc: The badges are divided into two categories:
Legend.cat1Desc: Competency badges contain information about the skills taught in a course or workshop. These can be both technical skills, such as mastering a specific programming language, and interdisciplinary skills, such as communication. These badges include information on the amount of time learners spent developing a skill in a course.
Legend.cat2Desc: A badge from the 'Participation' category only indicates the attendance of learners at events and does not contain information about taught or acquired skills.

About.fundingDesc: With the funding measure 'Open Photonik Pro', the Federal Ministry of Research, Technology and Space (BMFTR) pursues the goal of enabling new forms of cooperation between science and industry with the maker and startup scene. This is intended to open up additional innovation paths and potentials. At the same time, innovation cycles are to be significantly shortened and the networking of these groups is to be sustainably improved.

FAQ.faqInfo: On this page you will find answers to the most frequently asked questions about Open Educational Badges
FAQ.cantFindAnswer: If you cannot find the answer you are looking for, please feel free to
FAQ.A1.1: Open Educational Badges (OEB) are a tool to make learning experiences and the acquisition of skills visible in a standardized way. Open Educational Badges rely on three elements for this:
FAQ.A1.2: 1. A platform to create, award, and collect badges in a standardized way.
FAQ.A1.3: 2. The standardized ESCO skills framework, which makes credentials from different institutions comparable and compatible.
FAQ.A1.4: 3. An active community that uses badges.
FAQ.A1.5: Thanks to technical and content standardization, Open Educational Badges can be used everywhere – no matter where learning takes place.
FAQ.A1.6: Badges themselves are digital certificates that verifiably prove in a standardized way that learners have had certain learning experiences and acquired corresponding skills. They are based on an Open Badges standard originally developed by the Mozilla Foundation. From a purely technical point of view, Open Badges are digital images such as pictograms or logos that contain individual metadata – i.e., additional information that describes, for example, who receives this badge, which organization awarded it, and which skills were acquired.
FAQ.Q2: 2. What are Open Educational Badges useful for?
FAQ.A2.1: Open Educational Badges make learning experiences and the acquisition of skills visible – no matter where learning takes place.
FAQ.A2.2: Learners get a detailed overview of their individual skill profile. They know what they can do, where their strengths lie, and how they want to develop further.
FAQ.A2.3: Awarding institutions can use Open Educational Badges to make their learning opportunities visible. In addition, Open Educational Badges support them in documenting the impact of their work.
FAQ.A2.4: Recognizing institutions receive not only the formal grades of applicants, but also an individual skill profile. They have the opportunity to better assess applicants.
FAQ.Q3: 3. How do I award Open Educational Badges?
FAQ.A3: To award a badge, registration and the creation of an institution are necessary. Subsequently, the awarding institution creates a badge and awards it to the learners via their respective email addresses.
FAQ.Q4: 4. How is it ensured that an awarding person belongs to the specified institution?
FAQ.A4: Currently, access as an awarding person is only granted upon invitation. This ensures the trustworthiness of the awarding person.
FAQ.Q5: 5. How does the awarding of badges take place? Which services must or may I, as an institution, collect from the learners?
FAQ.A5: Data protection has the highest priority. Therefore, Open Educational Badges works with maximum data economy. To award a badge, the awarding institution needs the names of the participants and their corresponding email addresses. The participants receive their badge via the email addresses. The email addresses serve as identifiers to assign the badges to the learning individuals.
FAQ.A6: Technically, the badges are currently located on the Hetzner server of OpenSenseLab. As the project expands, there are plans to find a suitable location that ensures free access for learners at all times and guarantees the secure and permanent storage of the badges.

Profile.clickProviderBtn: Click one of the provider buttons below to sign in
Profile.useServiceInstead: use this service instead of your email address and password in the future.
Profile.accountAccess:
Would you like to give another app access to your Open Educational Badges account, for example to distribute badges automatically?
Then register a Client ID and a Client Secret for your account here.
Profile.idAndSecretSuccess: ATTENTION! Please copy your Client Secret, it will not be displayed again later. You can view the Client ID at any time.
Profile.appHasAccess: This app has access to your
Profile.deleteAppConfirm: Do you really want to delete your app credentials?
Profile.deleteAccountConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete your account? This cannot be undone.
Profile.mustBe8Char: Must be at least 8 characters long
Profile.dontHavePassword: You don't have your current password?
Profile.passwordInsecure: Your password must be unusual and contain at least 8 characters (including 1 capital letter, 1 number, and 1 special character).
Profile.passwordMinRequirements: (At least 8 characters, including 1 uppercase letter, 1 number, and 1 special character)
Profile.weIncreasedPasswordRequirements: We have increased our password requirements.
Profile.pleaseRenewPassword: Therefore, we kindly request that you update your password.
Profile.pleaseRenewPasswordInfo: Takes only a moment and provides greater protection.

Welcome.heading: Nice to see you!
Welcome.text1: You can now collect all your badges in your Backpack.
Welcome.text2: If you want to create and award badges, create your institution for this purpose.
Welcome.whatNext: What would you like to do next?

RequestBadge.fillForm: Fill out the form fields to request your badge.
RequestBadge.requestBadgeInfo1: Your request will then be approved by a person from
RequestBadge.requestBadgeInfo2: . Once this has happened, the badge will be sent to you by email.
RequestBadge.personalDataInfo: Information on the processing of your personal data can be found in our privacy policy.
RequestBadge.ageConfirmation: I confirm that I am 16 years or older. If I am younger than 16 years old: My parents or legal guardians know that I am providing my personal data for the use of the Open Educational Badges platform. I confirm that they agree to this.
RequestBadge.successMessage: You have successfully requested the badge.
RequestBadge.successMessage2: As soon as your request has been confirmed, you will receive the badge by email.
RequestBadge.nameValidationError: First and last name together may not exceed 35 characters.

IssueQr.list1: You fill in the details for the QR code award on this page and click on Generate QR code. You will be redirected to the QR code thus generated and can download it or take a screenshot.
IssueQr.list2: You show your learners the QR code – digitally or printed out.
IssueQr.list3: Your learners scan the QR code with their smartphone and are taken to an input form where they enter their first and last names and email address. They then send the form as a badge request.
IssueQr.list4: You can see the badge requests from your learners on the
IssueQr.list4.2: at OEB and can award the badges directly. They will be sent to the learners by email.

QrCode.savedSuccessfully: The QR code award has been successfully saved on the badge detail page.
QrCode.downloadedSuccessfully:
You have successfully downloaded the QR code.
Check your download folder.
QrCode.deleteQrAwardConfirm: Do you really want to delete the QR code award?
QrCode.openRequestsWillBeLost: All still open badge requests will be lost as a result.
QrCode.receiveEmails: I would like to be notified by email about new QR code requests
QrCode.description: If you create a QR code here, your learners can scan the generated QR code and collect the badge themselves.
QrCode.noQrCodes: You have not created any QR Codes yet
QrCode.creator: Creator
QrCode.invalidExpirationDateRange: The expiration date must be after the start date
QrCode.invalidDateRange: The end date may not be before the start date
QrCode.invalidDate: Please enter a date in the format YYYY/mm/dd
QrCode.missingStartDate: Please enter a start date for validity

LearningPath.lastBadgeInfo: Learners automatically receive the Micro Degree badge by e-mail, as soon as they have earned all badges in the learning path.
LearningPath.activationInfo: When you activate the learning path for use, you can no longer edit it afterwards.
LearningPath.activationInfo2: At the same time, learners who already have the badges included in the learning pathway automatically receive the Micro Degree Badge.
LearningPath.activateMdForUse: Unlock learning path for use
LearningPath.notActivatedYetStart: The learning path is not yet
LearningPath.flexibleSelectionInfo: Specify here how many of the selected badges must be earned in order for the learner to receive the Micro Degree:
LearningPath.learnersHaveTo2: of the badges selected above in order to receive the Micro Degree badge.

ErrorDialog.title: An error has occurred!
ErrorDialog.message: Below you can see the error message. If you believe the error is on our side, you can copy the error message and send it to us by email, or you can create an issue on GitHub.
